result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah Hedrington

records.addlTxt: Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    KERRI  CLEGHORN  $520.00   SCANNED INTO CASE 20CM45

Defendant Noah Hedrington not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Noah Hedrington.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is not competent and will not regain competency within the statutory time frame.  Corporations Counsel has not appeared to address a Chapter 51.  Court ordered case administratively closed.

Defendant Noah Hedrington not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Noah Hedrington.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctor's report. State and defense have received and reviewed the report.  Defendant has not regained competency and likely will not regain competency within the statutory period which expires 11-18-22.  Case is adjourned to 10-13-22 at 8:30 am for a hearing to determine if a Chapter 51 will be filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cover Sheet, filed.
filed.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Noah Hedrington not in court, in custody.  Julie Ann Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for a return on doctor's report.  Defendant is in Mendota.  No doctors report has been filed. Case is adjourned to 9-15-22 at 8:30 am for return on doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Noah Hedrington not in court, in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for a review hearing for a committment to Mendota.  No report has been filed.  Defendant is in Mendota.  Case is adjourned to 8-17-22 at 8:30 for a return on doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Hedrington Report
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
from Mendota Mental Health, filed.
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
Order appointing counsel, signed and filed.

Case in court for return on doctors report.   Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report. 
Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   
Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  
Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility FORTHWITH.  
Order of Commitment signed and filed.

Defendant Noah Hedrington in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Noah Hedrington in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Noah Hedrington appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter in Court for Return on Doctor's Report. Defendant is not eligible for public defender. Defendant requests Court appoint Counsel at the County Rate. Court APPOINTS Attorney Kerri Cleghorn.  Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $100.00.  Court will determine repayment at the conclusion of case.  Review hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; HEDRINGTON REPORT
Letter re:  defendant.
Order For Competency, signed and filed.

Defendant Noah Hedrington in court, in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared via video conference.
Defendant is requesting to represent himself. Court on it's own motion, raised competency.  Court is ordering the examination for competency and the ability for the defendant to represent himself.   Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Defendant is  REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. 
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Noah Hedrington in Court, in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**JUDGE HAVAS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Indigency hearing. Defendant also has Case 20CM45 and 20CM442 pending in Branch 10. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Plaisted was appointed by the Public Defender's Office on Defendant's other cases, 20CM45 and 20CM442. Court held colloquy with Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for Indigency hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 10. 
Indigency hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 09:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Court is unable to hear this case today.  Case adjourned to 3-7-22 at 1:30 pm
Court is unable to hear this today.  Case is adjourned to 3-4-22 at 8:30 am for and indigency hearing.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with TCC (DOB 07/30/84), NH (DOB 11/13/02), NAH (DOB 09/25/05), and any other immediate family members of
TCC that were not named in report (including children of the defendant). NH was assaulted, NAH was a witness.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Noah Hedrington in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Noah Hedrington in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Noah Hedrington appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Defense request Indigency Hearing.  
Indigency hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
